titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Stuart Holroyd, 1957-1958, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

change.item: Edits and rearrangement of content into requisite Lilly EAD structure, including addition of abstract, bioghist, scopecontent, controlaccess, relatedmaterial, and c01 levels of container list. Haley Suby.

Finding aid enhancement project. Kyra Triebold

did.abstract: The Holroyd mss., 1957-1958, consist of drafts of works by British "angry young men" author Stuart Holroyd, 1933-.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Stuart Holroyd, born in 1933 in Bradford, England, is a British writer associated with the "Angry Young Men" British literary movement. He wrote two books while he was in his twenties: Emergence from Chaos (1957), an analysis of six poets through the lens of spirituality and modernity, and the autobiography Flight and Pursuit (1959). After a sixteen-year hiatus, he returned to writing with the memoir of the angry young men, A Personal Progression (1975), and has since written on topics such as parapsychology and extraterrestrial life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Holroyd mss., 1957-1958, consist of drafts of Emergence from Chaos; drafts and notes of Flight and Pursuit: a Venture into Autobiography; draft of A Sense of Crisis; Notes for Cambridge Society Lecture; Notes for London Debating Society; Notes for 2 Notions; Notes for What Tragedy Is; and A Writer's Prospect, all by Stuart Holroyd, 1933- , author.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Holroyd mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See the Hopkins mss. and Wilson, C.H. mss., also at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
